content.description: The Start: On the right side of the boulder, start with your feet on the dark colored lip, right hand on the undercling, and left hand on the two finger crack crimp. Swing your right hand up to the sloper above the two finger crimp, adjust your feet along the ridge at the base of the boulder, and then bump your right hand to the large crack above.
content.location: The boulder is located at the top of the Leatherman's Cave Overlook. When walking up the hill from Junction 29, the boulder is to the right of the LL trail just before the overlook with the bench. The boulder is visible from the trail and about 30 feet away.Â

content.description: The crux is the first 25 to 30 feet of the climb, seeing as you can not place any pro until you reach the left moving horizontal crack. Climb the flake up to work the horizontal crack until you reach a vertical crack towards the left side of the wall.  There should be two parallel cracks here, both are great for pro. Number 3 is key to protect you from a deck.  Be careful of rope drag, but don't extend your pieces to much as there is a ledge underneath you.
content.protection: standard rack, doubles of .75 and 3's are good.  No bolts or fixed gear. You are able to top out.
content.location: From Honey Hollow head in towards Leathermans cave.  This climb is located on the front side of the wall directly back from the road.  There is a good size tree directly in front of the start of the climb, with a 8 to 10 foot high ledge immediately to your left.

content.description: This problem starts at the bottom left corner of the boulder.  working your way right using the underclings until you reach the end of the boulder. reach up for a sloper, before a good left heel hook. Once in position move your right hand up and swing your body around for a right heel hook.  Pull yourself up and top out.
content.location: From Honey Hollow, walk towards leathermans cave, when you see the large wall in front of you with the dozen or so boulders beneath it you have found your spot.  This problem sits about 20 feet back from the start of the climb Dont Flake Out.

content.description: Located off Honey Hollow Rd the Leatherman's Cave and surrounding area has good bouldering and short TR possibilities.
